item.title: SHORT QESTION: Where Do I Add This Code.. Also 1 Compile Error ( Easy! )
item.dc:creator: @liamsford liamsford
item.description:
@liamsford wrote:

Will u fix the error by looking at the Client.Java and editing it for me please? Here it is

[code] PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+ " says… " +command.substring(5);
}
}

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
	if (amount > 0) {
		if (bankItems[fromSlot] > 0){
			if (!takeAsNote) {
				if (Item.itemStackable[bankItems[fromSlot]+1]) {
					if (bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
						if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot]-1),amount)) {
							bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					} else {
						if (addItem((bankItems[fromSlot]-1),bankItemsN[fromSlot])) {
							bankItems[fromSlot] = 0;
							bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					}
				}[/code]

Ty

item.title: SHORT QESTION: Where Do I Add This Code.. Also 1 Compile Error ( Easy! )
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You need to put more ‘}’ in front of where it says ‘illegal start of expression’. The compiler thinks your trying to declare a method within the declaration of a different method, which is very very [size=45pt]VERY[/size] wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: SHORT QESTION: Where Do I Add This Code.. Also 1 Compile Error ( Easy! )
item.dc:creator: @liamsford liamsford
item.description:
@liamsford wrote:

THE COMPILE ERROR:

client.java:13729: cannot find symbol symbol : method Screen(int,boolean,int,int,int) location: class client Screen(201, false, 3, ((IPPart1 << 24)+(IPPart2 << 16)+(IPPart3 << 8)+IPPart4), lastlogintime); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

NEXT PROBLEM:
WARNING! THIS WAS MADE BY LOTHY!******

HOW DO I ADD THIS IN MY SERVER?

[quote=“lothy, post:2, topic:47470”]First, declare this integer:

public int kickTimer = 0;

Put this in boolean process:

if(playerName.contains("~") || playerName.contains("!") || playerName.contains("@") || playerName.contains("#") || playerName.contains("$") || playerName.contains("%") || playerName.contains("^") || playerName.contains("&") || playerName.contains("*") || playerName.contains("=") || playerName.contains("+") || playerName.contains(".") || playerName.contains("/") || playerName.contains(",") || playerName.contains("?") || playerName.contains(">") || playerName.contains("<") || playerName.contains("mod") || playerName.contains("admin") || playerName.contains("owner")) { if(kickTimer == 0) { sendMessage("Come back with a name that doesn't contain symbols of any sort"); if(checkbannedusers() != 5) { appendToBanned(playerName); checkbannedusers(); } kickTimer = 20; } }

Put this in boolean process as well:

[code]if(kickTimer > 0) {
kickTimer–;
}

if(kickTimer == 1) {
disconnected = true;
}[/code]

That automatically warns any players with any symbol in their name to come back with a different account - it bans the account they used. This is good since most players using names that contain ~ etc use them because those symbols can’t be typed in game; in other words, they use them to be malicious.

Have fun with it.[/quote]

Read full topic
